title: Homebrew wants to remove a package, which has not been installed via Homebrew

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: PR was locked due to age

body:
### `brew config` output

```shell
CPU: octa-core 64-bit skylake
Clang: 12.0 build 1200
Git: 2.30.2 => /usr/local/bin/git
Curl: 7.64.1 => /usr/bin/curl
macOS: 10.15.7-x86_64
CLT: 12.0.0.32.29
Xcode: N/A
```

### 

- [ ] The `brew doctor` above contains no "Warning" lines.

### What were you trying to do (and why)?

I ran `brew update` and `brew upgrade` where Homebrew noticed that the cleanup hasn't been run in the last 30 days, so it started the cleanup and quits with the error message:

```
Error: Permission denied @ apply2files - /usr/local/lib/prey/versions/1.9.9/.DS_Store
```

### What happened (include all command output)?

I ran `brew update` and `brew upgrade`, when brew started a cleanup, which stops with an error (see above)

### What did you expect to happen?

I expected the cleanup to run through without any errors, especially because Prey has not been installed via Homebrew but via a macOS package. I guess both use the same path, hence Homebrew claims it and wants to clean it.

### Step-by-step reproduction instructions (by running `brew` commands)

```shell
brew cleanup
```
